greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = minimal k such that n has a partition into k parts with the property that every number <= m can be partitioned into a subset of these parts.
link: E. O'Shea, M-partitions: optimal partitions of weight for one scale pan, Discrete Math. 289 (2004), 81-93.
O. J. Rodseth, Enumeration of M-partitions, Discrete Math., 306 (2006), 694-698.
formula: If 2^m + 2^(m-1) - 1 <= n <= 2^(m+1) - 1 for some m, let i = 2^(m+1) - 1 - n. Then a(n) = A000123([i/2]). This determines half the values.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 31 2004
